Articles.Content:
So, I was derping around the wiki when I stumble upon an article on Kerbals and read that they speak reversed Spanish in the trailers. So, I googled it and only 5 results actually showed up, with the rest being Google trying to guess what I was looking for, so I set out to translate what they're saying. I also discovered squad's headquarters (and possibly developers) are in Mexico City which is pretty exciting because I'm from Mexico too. Anyway, here is what they're saying in the 0.16 teaser trailer:

All: Oooh! Wooow!

Seriously, it turned out great!

It's awesome!

*Bill or Bob stares blankly at it while others leave*

Leave that moron behind!

Oh noes! They're leaving!

*faceplant*

I'm new here btw

Nice to know, I was curious!

I used audacity to try to translate it myself but I don't speak spanish
What are they saying in the Mission Control video?
how exactly do you go about translating that?

how exactly do you go about translating that?

Play the audio backwards, then write it down and pop it into Google Translate?
Record it, load it into audacity or similar software and use the reverse feature.

how do you play it backwards?

I suspect by using an audio editor, someone mentioned Audacity.
And no need to Google Translate, he is mexican himself, like the developers

Well, In the 0.20 release trailer the only thing they say is "quitese!" or "Move it!" when they fight over who gets to be in front of the camera, and in the Mission Control Video it's this:

*random chatter*

*Gene says something I can't understand. Like in the U.S, people speak differently depending on the regions they're in*

Bobak: What are you doing nene (equivalent of kid or baby)?, no! nene, no!

*Bobak starts shaking Gene*

Now there are multiple ways of interpreting the following because they sound similar in the video but have different meanings.

Bobak: Ahh, no! Oh god! Oh god! (makes more sense)

or

Bobak: Ahh, no! Help! Help!

And I couldn't translate the rest. Chilangos or people from Mexico City speak very fast, so I'll probably have to slow it down and reorder the phrases.
ive made a chart that has many translations of english to kerbish check it out if you want
but are the kerbals prouncing the backwards spanish in english or spanish
